jdraw.framework
Interface DrawCommandHandler

public interface DrawCommandHandler

The interface DrawCommandHandler defines the handler which allows to access the command history provided by a draw model. The list of commands can be iterated through using methods undo and redo.

Version:
2.5
Author:
Dominik Gruntz & Christoph Denzler
See Also:
DrawCommandHandler

Method Summary
 void addCommand(DrawCommand cmd)
          Adds a new command to the command list at the current position.
 void beginScript()
          Opens a script.
 void clearHistory()
          Clears the command list.
 void endScript()
          Closes a script.
 void redo()
          Redoes the next command in the command list.
 boolean redoPossible()
          Indicates whether a redo operation is possible.
 void undo()
          Undoes the last command in the command list.
 boolean undoPossible()
          Indicates whether an undo operation is possible.
 

Method Detail

addCommand

void addCommand(DrawCommand cmd)
Adds a new command to the command list at the current position. The added command is not executed by this method. Commands which were stored behind the current position are discarded.

Parameters:
cmd - draw command which is added to command list

undo

void undo()
Undoes the last command in the command list. This command can be redone with operation redo unless new commands are added to the command list.

See Also:
redo()

redo

void redo()
Redoes the next command in the command list.

See Also:
undo()

undoPossible

boolean undoPossible()
Indicates whether an undo operation is possible.

Returns:
whether undo is possible
See Also:
undo()

redoPossible

boolean redoPossible()
Indicates whether a redo operation is possible.

Returns:
whether redo is possible
See Also:
redo()

beginScript

void beginScript()
Opens a script. Commands added with method addCommand after a script has been opened are collected until endScript is called. These command are then combined to a macro command.

See Also:
endScript()

endScript

void endScript()
Closes a script. All commands added since the last open beginScript call are combined to a macro command.

See Also:
beginScript()

clearHistory

void clearHistory()
Clears the command list.
